title: Experience on its own
text:
There's so much to do in the hotel grounds alone that you barely need to leave at all! There are several types of activities ranging from workshops and animal encounters to karaoke. There's a miniature "zoo", outdoor pools, and a fantasy park. You can put a lot of time in just exploring the grounds for all the novelties they have at place and it's all very interesting. It's a great place for families with children!

The rooms are quite big, which was impressive and the decor is very simple but functional. However the plumbing seems to be quite out of date as it was very noisy, at least that was the case in our specific vila. It was also quite weird that the doors had one actual, physical key, so if you are travelling with other people you are pretty much glued to each other whenever out and about.

The breakfast and every other dining experience is held at the same place, a restaurant in the middle of the grounds. It has a very nice rustic decor and delicious food, however on a busy night it gets incredibly hot inside and there's no air conditioning.

title: Halloween 2019
text:
First of all, I visited the castle during the annual Halloween party that is hosted there, so my experience does not extend to regular operating hours.

It's a fantastic castle with an air of history to it, might be bit hard to navigate and I imagine gets crowded really quickly. There are various exhibits around the castle, ranging from the history of Vlad Tepes and Dracula myth to medieval torture devices. It's certainly a touristy location but well worth the trip if you are even little bit of a Dracula-nut!

On the downside, the castle is not accessible to those with mobility issues. There are restrooms but they are quite poorly marked, and the gift shop is very poor selection.

title: My first synagogue visit
text:
Beautiful synagogue with a holocaust memorial right next to it, this was a lovely introduction to synagogues to me. There's a small fee to enter but it's well worth it to see the details of the inside decor. There are restrooms on the outside of the synagogue, on the opposite side of where the memorial is.

Have to admit I'm not entirely sure about the opening hours as the synagogue seemed to be closed when we first arrived, then open a little bit later, and closed as soon as we left it.

title: Pretentious
text: While the exhibits are interesting, the museum itself is quite expensive and not really worth it. It's also rather peculiar for them to require you to wear coverings over your shoes in order to enter. Photography is allowed but you have to pay for it, as if the entry fee wasn't enough already!

title: Well preserved history
text: This fortress is pretty much in the middle of nowhere so it might be tricky to get to. Once there, the only thing to really see is the fortress itself, which is surely amazing but might not be enough for every traveller. The ruins are interesting but there is basically no information about them as you walk among them. There are restrooms outside of the ruins themselves, so be prepared for that and do your business before entering.

title: Great stay
text:
Beautiful quality hotel by the river, you'll be doing bit of uphill walking to get to the centre of the town from here. The rooms are clean and had good amount of amenities, very comfortable beds as well. The breakfast has a wide selection of different offerings for every taste.

You'll either be getting a town or a river view, both of which are quite nice. On the other side of the river is a lovely church you might want to go take a closer look at.

title: Tourist trap
text: There's no doubt about it, this place is more of a tourist trap than a historical exhibit. It's almost tacky and the souvenirs are definitely overpriced to match. However the service and food were both excellent, so it's not a loss for a Dracula lover to come here. Would not recommend going to Sighisoara only to see this place though.

title: Very narrow
text: You won't miss the clock tower when in the town and it is worth taking the time to visit inside of it. Just be ready that the stairs are quite narrow, which will make it bit of a trick to pass others. On your way to the top, there are several rooms that hold historical objects for you to look at but there are no English texts available. From the top the view is great over all of the town.

title: Historical area
text: You'll likely be coming by the famous stairs that lead up to the church and if you have time to spare, might as well go all the way up. The church and the adjacent cemetery are quite beautiful, however the church's charm is mostly on its outside as the decor is quite plain. I'll also give this church a lot of respect for having informational pamphlets available in a lot of languages, the selection was the most inclusive I've seen in any other attraction to date.

title: Didn't actually see inside the cathedral itself
text: The cathedral was undergoing renovations during my visit, so I only saw a small exhibition area and the clocktower. There was no English text available but the tower itself was pretty interesting to visit.

title: Beautiful art
text: Beautiful cathedral with a rich history, it's quite modest from the outside but a lot of details on the inside It's located right in the centre of the town, so you shouldn't miss it.

title: Great food, lackluster service
text:
Came here after having seen photos of some of their dishes, mainly the soup-inside-bread one. The mood of the restaurant is lovely in its traditional decor, and the food is excellent. On the downside the restaurant is also kinda expensive considering local standards, but this likely won't be an issue to many tourists since it is still affordable.

The service was the biggest "problem" as the waiters seemed almost confused as to why we were there and were very slow, despite there not being many other customers at the time.

title: Fantastic food
text: Hotel and a restaurant, this was a lovely place to visit. The remote location is very beautiful. The food was extremely delicious, though the service was very slow even though there were no other customers at the time.

title: The famed grave
text: I'm sure most of us visitors come to this monastery for the famed grave and if you are interested in it, then you won't be disappointed. It's a nice little site and a pretty area, they even have some animals there. Photography is allowed with a fee.

title: Gorgeous
text: Absolutely gorgeous monastery area, the church obviously being the main attraction. It's worth the trip for sure. Photography is allowed with a small fee. There is also a "gift shop" inside a bigger, more plain looking church.

title: Quick stop
text: Nice little monastery worth the stop if you are in the area. Photography is allowed, though remember to be mindful of any services taking place.

title: Take a look inside
text: This church is quite unassuming from the outside and it's easy to simply walk past it without really paying attention. It's definitely worth to take a peek inside as the altar area is gorgeous. It's free to enter and quite small, so you won't be "wasting" much time during the visit. Photography is allowed!

title: Bigger on the outside
text: Wandering into this museum while passing by and was surprised by how much smaller the exhibition areas were than I expected. The building is surely intimidating from the outside, but it doesn't take too long to go over the entire museum. There are different types of displays, all divided into neat sections. It's all very interesting, though it was bit disappointed that there was no English text for all of it. Still a pretty good experience. The museum also has storage lockers available for your disposal!
place: Muzeul National de Istorie a Romaniei

title: Enough for a whole day
text: Great outdoor "museum" of old buildings, showcasing history in a really concrete way. You can even enter some of the buildings to see reconstructed rooms. There is a lot of them as well, so you can definitely spend a whole day here learning about everything. Obviously it's not very fun rainy day activity and there won't be any places to really 'keep the rain' either. There are restrooms at the site, though there could definitely be couple more of those around the area.

title: Just to admire the decor
text: Let's be honest, you will be coming here mainly for the beautiful decor. You won't be alone, as the restaurant is constantly packed with people and extremely loud - you will not hear what someone two chairs down is saying unless they are directly yelling to you. The service is also slow because of how busy the place is and you have to keep good track of what you've ordered as the servers might forget to bring a drink to you, but they sure won't forget to charge you for it anyway! The food itself is decent though naturally overpriced.

title: Youth bar
text: The food was okay, but personally I'm not a fan of such dirty locale. They offered peanuts to snack on and there were peanut shells absolutely everywhere, on the tables and all over the floor. Seeing this didn't really inspire confidence on what the kitchen might look like if the customer side was so neglected.

title: Fantastic view
text: This hotel is a bit off to the side from the main streets of the town but it comes with the trade of great ocean view (if you have a room facing that way, of course). Despite the hotel being little farther off, the distance from the center and beach isn‚Äôt terrible but it‚Äôll be an uphill walk to get back. They have a nice outdoor dining area where they‚Äôll play live music and have traditional dancing, in which you can participate as well. Surprisingly good sound-proofing in the room as well, the music wasn't bothersome at all.

title: Tiny
text: This museum is very small and houses some sculptures from the archaeological site. If you're there, you might as well go to the museum as well but don't be sorry if you miss it. If you've went around other historical museums in the country, this one will only seem like an exhibit at best and won't be seeing anything you haven't seen already.

title: Ancient marvel
text: Undoubtedly you‚Äôve heard about the perfect acoustics of this ancient theatre, but wonder if it‚Äôs actually worth it to go just to experience it. In my opinion, it truly is worth it. It works perfectly and if you come in early enough, you can test it out with at length. The surrounding ruins are interesting part of history as well to look through.

title: Slippery slope
text: Magnificent site of history, it‚Äôs worth the walk up to the main top to see the view. You should be careful though, because the stones and walkaways are extremely slippery even when dry! Wear good shoes and be prepared for it, and also take the time to go to the Treasure of Atreus bit to the side.

title: Mask of Agamemnon
text: This small museum to the side of the archaeological site houses objects related to the place itself, so there‚Äôs no reason to skip it if you‚Äôre visiting the site itself. It‚Äôs laid out nicely and has plenty to see, but you‚Äôll specifically want to find Mask of Agamemnon. It‚Äôs worth to note that for such an important place, the museum‚Äôs shop is one of the worst I‚Äôve ever come across.

title: Fancy
text: This grand restaurant seems to be in the middle of nowhere, but is actually quite busy due to a lot of people passing by. It has a classic exterior and very fancy interior, but isn‚Äôt terribly expensive regardless. Their food is pretty good as well, so it‚Äôd be worth it if you are in the area.

title: Long wait
text: It's a charming little restaurant with decent food, but the wait time for a simple omelette was way too much. The toilets are also poorly maintained.

title: Difficult terrain
text: Great piece of history preserved and worthy of visit, but not even remotely accessible. There are no build walkways, so you‚Äôll be just walking in nature. If you wish to go to the very top for some spectacular views, you are just straight up hiking and the ground gets very uneven and treacherous. Be sure to have good shoes without open toes!

title: Decent stay at central location
text: Great central location and rooms facing the street have a nice view over everything. Even though the hotel is right by a big busy street, there wasn't excessive noise. Best water pressure than in any other hotel I stayed at in Greece. No blankets on the bed though. The breakfast was little lackluster.

title: Beautiful grounds
text: Okay room but the bathroom seemed outdated and the tub had no plug to it. The water pressure was incredibly poor and if you had the sink faucet fully open, it would ‚Äòspit‚Äô water on you from the seams. The hotel area is huge and they had a lot of services for you to take advantage of.

title: Good food
text: Closely located to the archeological site and museum, this is a good stop for a quick lunch. The food is good and prices aren't too steep, the service was faster than I had gotten used to locally. There's also plenty of goodies to buy as souveniers or snacks, varying from local candies to olive oils and honeys.

title: Interactive experience
text: Situated right in the heart of everything in the small town, it‚Äôd be hard to miss this tiny ‚Äòmuseum.‚Äô It‚Äôs free to visit so I would absolutely recommend taking a short moment to look inside. You can donate to them but it‚Äôs not mandatory and nobody will pressure you about it. The place is packed with exhibits you can interact with so it‚Äôs also good location to go with children.

title: Poor air
text:
Located bit to the side from the main archaeological site and museum, this one could be easy to overlook. Entry is included in the same ticket so it‚Äôs worth to go take a look if you have the time. It‚Äôs a relatively small museum, which was almost empty even during the peak time I visited. Considering how stuffy the air was during my visit, I would want to avoid it when there‚Äôs plenty of people!

There‚Äôs text in four different languages with the displays and photography is allowed. There‚Äôs also toilets near the museum, to its left side in a small ‚Äúcabin‚Äù that might be easy to walk past but you‚Äôll likely avoid lines by going there instead of the other places!

title: Good displays
text: The museums houses a lot of artifacts from the nearby site and has a lot of fascinating pieces of history. It‚Äôs a good walk through and a nice layout, however there‚Äôs only one place to sit throughout the walk.

title: Accessible
text: Grand area with plenty of old ruins to see, and it‚Äôs mostly on level ground so it‚Äôs easier for visitors with mobility issues. There‚Äôs no paved walkways though and barely any benches, but you could just sit on any flat stone around you. It‚Äôs definitely worth the walk to see the history around you.

title: Quite a trek
text: As expected, you need a decent level of fitness to see the entire archaeological site. There‚Äôs only one paved walkway you can take and it doesn‚Äôt go even halfway to the top, but it will help you see some of the important bits if you aren‚Äôt able to make it all the way. There are restrooms located near the gate, so it‚Äôs best to do your business before starting your hike. It‚Äôs definitely a good place to visit if you‚Äôre interested in the history!

title: No seating
text: Nice layout and flow to the museum, it was easy to see everything without worry that you‚Äôd be walking past something important. They allow photography as long as you aren‚Äôt taking selfies, which is very good policy to have. However they had not put effort into seating at all despite there being quite a few opportunities to allow visitors a break from the walking.

title: Big room with a view
text: Spacious room with a nice view over the area with a small balcony. Huge bed, even the single bed felt bigger than regularly! However the water pressure was incredibly poor and I gave up on the idea to take a bath as the water would‚Äôve gotten cold long before the tub would‚Äôve been even half full. Considering the rest of the hotel, the breakfast was quite lackluster but this might have been due to there not seeming to be that many guests staying there at the same time.

title: Attentive servers
text: Good location and a nice air-y place. The restrooms were very clean and the staff was attentive at all times. The food was decent, but they didn‚Äôt seem to even know what juices they had on the menu when trying to order some of them.

title: No photos
text:
There‚Äôs no doubt that the monasteries in this area wouldn‚Äôt be gorgeous and worth visiting at least one of them, but it should be noted that they are quite strict with the ‚Äòno photos‚Äô policy from indoors. They also do insist that women must wear skirts, so you should be dressed appropriately before arriving. The strictness about men‚Äôs dress code varies, but I‚Äôd still suggest wearing long pants and at the very least a T-shirt with sleeves. Common decency goes a long way, these are places of worship after all even if you‚Äôre just a tourist ‚Äì be respectful at all times.

There's quite a bit of stair climbing to do in order to get to this monastery, so it isn't a good choice for those with mobility issues. The area itself is quite small, but there is also a mini museum at the site you can look through.

title: No photos
text:
There‚Äôs no doubt that the monasteries in this area wouldn‚Äôt be gorgeous and worth visiting at least one of them, but it should be noted that they are quite strict with the ‚Äòno photos‚Äô policy from indoors. They also do insist that women must wear skirts, so you should be dressed appropriately before arriving. The strictness about men‚Äôs dress code varies, but I‚Äôd still suggest wearing long pants and at the very least a T-shirt with sleeves. Common decency goes a long way, these are places of worship after all even if you‚Äôre just a tourist ‚Äì be respectful at all times.

This particular monastery was very strict about the dress code, witnessed several men be turned away by the nuns because they were wearing cargo shorts rather than long pants. This is also very busy and popular monastery, so expect there to be a crowd and the religious will be in "your way" at every turn.

title: Visitor to our room
text: Good location and spacious room, but the bed was very uncomfortable and unsteady. They weren‚Äôt finished updating their systems during our stay since the room had an actual key to it. Someone (NOT staff) also tried entering the room, which looked to be very easy for that person to accomplish thanks to the old system.

title: Beautiful view
text: Located bit to the side of the town itself so it‚Äôs a quiet dining experience with a beautiful view. Not the fastest service, so definitely don‚Äôt come expecting a fast meal! The food itself was edible but not a treat.

title: Cozy atmosphere
text: Nice location just below Acropolis and they‚Äôve made sure to capitalize on that with a glass ceiling, allowing you to view the ruins as you eat. There‚Äôs not much room but the place isn‚Äôt horribly packed either, but it is definitely more on the cozy side. The food is good and prices aren‚Äôt awful, the staff are also were attentive and nice.

title: Quick bite
text: Okay food and quite big portions, nicely located as well. The menu was in several languages so that was impressive.

title: A Must See
text: You simply can‚Äôt be in Athens without going to the Acropolis. You can view the ancient ruins from around the city, but actually walking among them is still the superior version of experiencing the feeling of them as a whole. Remarkable site of history.

title: No photos allowed
text: I had looked forward to visiting this museum and found myself rather disappointed. The place is quite big and has many fascinating artifacts, but they‚Äôve failed to make it enjoyable to stay, which is what my rating is based on. The air is extremely stale, felt like there was no air conditioning and I witnessed three people actually collapse during my visit. This is made worse by the fact that there are barely any places to sit while you‚Äôre trying to enjoy the exhibits. The nail in the coffin is surely the fact that they don‚Äôt allow photos and the staff are very aggressive about enforcing this. Honestly wouldn‚Äôt bother with this one again.
place: Skip the Line: Athens New Acropolis Museum Ticket

title: Good stay and service
text: My room was okay, but bit of a tight fit with the layout from the door. Had a "corner room" so to speak. Wasn‚Äôt cleaned too well considering that found hair in the bathroom. The breakfast room is at the top of the hotel and has a gorgeous view of the Acropolis, which was very lovely but the breakfast room is quite tiny so you better hope there aren't many others coming at the same time! Food selection was decent. Nice staff too and a great location in the city.

title: Poor visit
text: For a hotel touting itself under ‚Äòpremium‚Äô this was a subpar accommodation at best. The lobby area looks extravagant but the actual room was terrible. It was tiny and the bathroom was tinier still, you couldn‚Äôt even sit on the toilet without your legs hitting the tub, the door, and the sink plumbing all at the same time! The plumbing was also incredibly noisy for several minutes after you flushed, so I doubt the building‚Äôs plumbing is up to code. Everything else was noisy as well, the room was on a high floor but you could still clearly hear a lot of partying from below. Uncomfortable, hard bed and only one of everything for two people (one blanket, one towel, etc). There were also surveys to fill about your stay but they didn‚Äôt provide pens, assuming because they actually don‚Äôt want your opinion. Luckily it was a short stay and would never return to this hotel again.

title: No signage
text: I never made it inside because there didn‚Äôt seem to be any signs in English telling you where you could do so. I was trying to look around for a while since I knew there should‚Äôve been a museum or exhibit indoors, but the lack of signage of any kind made me give up. Nice from the outside though.

title: Would tour with them again
text:
Professionally organized and you could tell they were experienced just from the effortless way the tour operator handled everything. He was even kind enough to wait a little while after the allocated departure time for some people who hadn‚Äôt yet arrived and made sure everyone had proper equipment for the trip (passport, clothing, etc).

Our guide was knowledgeable and laidback, he made sure we followed the itinerary to see everything promised but still allowed us enough free time for plenty of photos. Would absolutely recommend them and am considering taking another trip arranged by them in the future!

title: Worth the visit
text: Good sized museum in a central location, it‚Äôs free of charge so it‚Äôs certainly worth the visit. The museum covers many conflicts throughout history, naturally focusing more on the Swedish perspective when it comes to world wars. There‚Äôs a lot of information and almost all of it is also provided in English. There are also some interactive displays, which brings an extra layer of interest to the place. Overall a very good museum!

title: Interesting for the whole family
text: Very central location so you are bound to walk by this museum and might as well take a look inside. Despite what it seems like from the outside, the museum is actually quite small and only consists of one hall. There‚Äôs still plenty of interesting displays and during my visit I noticed that children specially seemed to find a lot of entertainment in the area. Overall decent museum and I‚Äôd specially commend it for having plenty of seating available.

title: Royal resting place
text: One of the oldest Swedish churches, you‚Äôd expect this to be little more impressive but it is rather mediocre. The church has an important place in history and still holds some of the remains of the royal families that have ruled over the country. It is probably the biggest selling point to come see their resting places, but regretfully you aren‚Äôt really allowed to properly see the ones in the ‚Äòcrypt‚Äô area. Not a must visit but if you are in the area then you might as well take a look inside. You can purchase a separate admission ticket but you can also have a joined ticket for the Royal Palace and this church.

title: Small
text: This little museum is located pretty much under the Royal Palace and you can visit it with the same ticket as for the Palace itself. It wouldn‚Äôt really be worth it to come here on its own as the museum is very tiny and doesn‚Äôt really have much of anything special to showcase about the former palace.

title: Be sure to visit when in Stockholm
text:
Central location so when you are visiting Stockholm, you‚Äôre bound to notice the Palace at some point. The same admission ticket allows you entry to the royal apartments, the royal chapel, the armoury, the treasury, and two little museums that center around history of the palace right next to the palace itself. It‚Äôs plenty to see with one ticket so you surely get your money‚Äôs worth, and with little extra you can also include a visit to the nearby Riddarholmen Church which holds the remains of some members of the Swedish royals.

If you‚Äôve visited palaces before then this one isn‚Äôt anything shocking, on the contrary you might be finding the Swedish palace to be much more down to earth than others. It is still interesting to take a look around, and you will likely have a lot more breathing room than in other similar sites. I visited during peak time and yet could fully take in several locations without a crowd, even walking through the hall of mirrors completely alone!

One point of critique for the Royal Apartments would be how dark it was there. They had elected to keep all the heavy curtains closed and so it was very dimly lit.
place: The Royal Palace in Stockholm Admission Ticket

title: Overpriced
text:
This hotel is in a central location in the city and a large portion of sights are within walking distance. The rooms are quite spacious while the bathrooms seem to be surprisingly small, at least this was the case for the room I stayed in. The room doesn‚Äôt come with usual comforts you might expect from a fancier place like this, which was surprising. The beds are comfortable and the room is clean, like the rest of the hotel. The staff respect the ‚ÄúDo Not Disturb‚Äù sign.

Breakfast at the hotel is pretty good, the selection is impressive and the service is fast. Only thing lacking is the option of fruits available. Overall I had a pleasant stay at Scandic Park, but I can‚Äôt rate it higher due to not feeling like the value for my money was right. It was quite overpriced rate for what was present.

title: Get more than you expect!
text:
For a budget hotel Ville is surprisingly high end. I stayed in a single room with a private bathroom and was pleasantly taken back by how spacious the room and bathroom were, with a ton of amenities. The room had a mini fridge, microwave, electric fan, both electric kettle and coffee maker, and plates and eating utensils. Additionally they had provided dish soap! The cleanliness of the room was up to bar, I had no complaints over anything in the room. Even the general noise level was lower than I expected, considering that the hotel is located next to a busy street.

Location is great, quite close to the city center and bus station. The walk is straightforward but there‚Äôs also a bus service with a stop right next to the hotel/restaurant. The building itself may seem low end from the outside but is decently renovated from the inside. Check-in was incredibly quick and done at the restaurant since there is no check-in office, so I might count that as a slight minus that you are obligated to arrive to the hotel during the restaurant‚Äôs open hours. There‚Äôs no elevator, so coming with heavy luggage might be an issue if you have to haul it all the way to the top floor and other end of the building.

Also worth noting that there‚Äôs no breakfast at this hotel, but there‚Äôs a supermarket across the street so you can buy some basic breakfast supplies to make something in your room. For my needs this was a great property and if I‚Äôll have a need to stay in Tampere again, I‚Äôll most likely stay at Hotel Ville.

title: No photography allowed
text:
Boasting itself to be the world‚Äôs first espionage museum, this little place is tucked away inside a foodcourt/mall of sorts. There are plenty of signs so you will find it and might even take a look at everything else going on. The size of the museum itself is quite small as it is basically just one room with displays of gadgets and information posters along the walls. There‚Äôs some interactive portions, like being able to walk through a tunnel where you‚Äôll be ‚Äúspied upon‚Äù or partaking in some activities of solving mysteries.

The museum has done quite a good job in looking at espionage from a global perspective rather than local, but there‚Äôs a lot of information that is only displayed in Finnish. Interestingly there were couple instances where they had supplied Russian translation for an object or two, but there was no more than that. I guess you can just read the information online anyway, but considering the quite steep entry price and the fact that they don‚Äôt allow any photography it‚Äôs not a good trade off.

title: Take a picture with Lenin and Stalin
text:
This museum is the first Lenin museum that was founded outside of the Soviet Union and also simultaneously the last to remain to this day. It is located in the very same building where Lenin and Stalin first met each other, so it is quite a historical building on its own.

The architecture of the building is interesting to look at and the museum is easy to locate within, the museum itself consist only of one large room. As you‚Äôd expect it focuses on Lenin‚Äôs life as well the Soviet Union in general, with a lot of talk about Stalin on the side.

The displays are decent and offered in three languages ‚Äì Finnish, Russian and English. There‚Äôs also a photo opportunity with dummies of Lenin and Stalin, you can even dress up for it. Decent museum, would recommend for those interest in history or if you just happen to be in the area.

title: Better from the outside
text: Impressive from the outside and you‚Äôll surely see other tourists taking their photos with it on the stairs leading up. This is why going inside can be a bit of a letdown since there isn‚Äôt anything grandiose about the interior, you‚Äôll see more decorated churches elsewhere. There are paid restrooms inside.

title: Free and nice
text: Unassuming building from the outside that holds a handful of old tram cars on display inside. Free entry and restrooms, it‚Äôs nothing really special or a must-see but if you are spending few days in Helsinki then it‚Äôs worth dropping by.

title: Limited opening days
text: Located inside a fire station, this is a really sweet little museum! There are clear signs to show you to the museum so you don‚Äôt need to feel intimidated by the size of the building itself. The museum covers three floors of space and has an elevator as well. There are restrooms and free storage lockers on site as well. Photos are allowed and the entry is cheap. Really good museum but it is only open two days a week, Wednesdays and Sundays, so be sure to plan your visit accordingly if you want to see this gem!

title: Expensive but good museum
text:
Good museum in a central location, only short walk away from the train station and bus terminal. The entry fee is a bit steep but you are allowed to come and go from the museum with the same ticket during the day, and the lockers for your belongings are free. There is also a lunch cafe on site, which seemed to be fairly decent and not too expensive.

The museum itself spans several floors and is very nicely laid out, allowing you to view everything in orderly fashion. Information is available in three languages, but on some occasions English is missing. Overall it‚Äôs a good museum worth the visit if you are interested in the subject, and if you happen to have children I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll enjoy it as well.

title: Bit of a surprise
text:
Located on two floors inside an electronics shop near the marina, this small exhibit is free to visit at your leisure. There is no staff and very minimal information, but I suspect anyone coming to visit is there for the nostalgia more than anything else. It‚Äôs worth taking a look if you are arriving/leaving the city via a ferry but not really worth the trouble to specifically come see.

Note: You can also take the elevator all the way to the roof of the same building if you wish to take a look at the MiG-21BIS fighter jet on display there.
place: Computer and Game Console Museum Helsinki

title: Restroom below
text:
This is your average, beautiful church that you might as well wander into if you are in the area. It's more impressive from the inside and out, and you can also visit the crypt for a small fee.

There are public restrooms "under" the church. If facing the main entrace, simply go to the right hand side and down, then take a left - you should be able to see the signs for the restroom. It does cost you to use but restrooms are scarce so you might as well use it here.

title: Don't bother looking for the restrooms
text: Gorgeous architechture and certainly a worthy visit. Just don't go here expecting to get a restroom break, they have several signs stating no restroom service - which instantly takes one star away from my rating.

title: Good decor, that's about it
text:
Themed maritime restaurant, the decor of this place is very well thought out and serves to create a nice atmosphere. However that's where my compliments end: during our visit there didn't seem to be any type of air conditioning at all. It wasn't even incredibly hot day (around 24¬∞C/73¬∞F) and not many other guests were in the restaurant at the time, yet the air was absolutely dead. Very uncomfortable to sit and resulted in just hurrying to eat so could get out to breathe.

The food was rather poor, I truly expected a delicious fish to come out of this themed restaurant but found it watery and flavorless. The only reason I finished it was because it had been paid for and I didn't want to waste money.

title: Steps into the building
text:
Bit to the side, this hotel is more of a stop for anyone intending to only stay the night and continue traveling in the morning. It's close to the highway so a good choice for anyone driving. It's worth noting that the entrance to the hotel includes steps, so it is difficult for hard of mobility to enter this building.

The hotel has a peculiar lock system that seemed to be causing a lot of guests issues in not being able to access their rooms without a member of staff coming up to aid them. Rooms themselves were nice and tidy. Breakfast area is quite small and gets crowded easily.

title: Good quality stay
text:
Good location, a walking distance away from the centre and excellent for any train traveler as the station is a coin toss away. There's also a Rewe (supermarket) very close that is open late if you find yourself in need of a snack after late arrival.

Very spacious hotel with an air of luxury to it, the rooms are comfortable and clean. However wifi is somewhat of an issue if it decides to work or not, and there's nothing to be done if it simply won't work.

Kitchen staff seemed disinterested in their jobs, witnessed several different guests noting something missing from the buffet and they were only met with indifference. Those missing items were never filled, leading to the assumption that they were also quite unprepared in how much to have of everything.
place: Best Western Plus Plaza Hotel Darmstadt

title: Decent for passing by
text: Located amidst several car dealerships, there's not really anything to see in the area so don't pick this hotel for your sightseeing base. Rooms are tidy and comfortable, nothing too special. Staff are okay however seemed to be quite unprepared in the kitchen as they ran out of several items early in the service.

title: Great service
text:
The hotel itself is pretty nice, spacious and comfortable clean rooms. However little puzzled over the construction choice of creating a window to the shower so your possible travel companion will you see showering, I was traveling alone so it wasn't an issue (luckily).

I need couple extra services from the staff, including my meal at a later date than originally agreed upon. The staff were very accommodating and friendly over these burdens I placed on them.

Not an ideal location for my Paris visit but had to stay here due to complications. It's a little far from the main attractions and the nearest underground station is a decent walk away.

title: Culturally significant
text:
It's the Louvre, of course you're gonna go see it. Absolutely essential to see even during a shorter visit to the city. You can lose days here if you are really interested in art, but for the most important bits you'll only need couple hours if you want to breeze through for the culture experience. I recommend buying your ticket in advance.

The 'main attractions' are clearly marked in the museum map and for those only heading to see Mona Lisa, there are continuous signs to keep you on the right direction. Easy to arrive to and easy to depart, there's an underground station right below the museum that you can get to without going outside.

title: Skip the line
text: I may have had my expectations higher due to this being among my must-see locations in Paris, but I ended up finding the catacombs to be overrated. Interesting experience nonetheless, but had I waited in line for it I would've been a bit sour about how much we were actually allowed to see of the complex itself. Best to purchase a timed ticket if you're sure you want to go! There's very very limited amount of text written down so the audio guide will be your main source of information while walking around.

title: Memorial wall is the best part
text: Free to visit but little difficult to enter and exit, I was very inexperienced with this type of system and gave the unfriendly staff bit of trouble on both occasions. Lots of text and photos to go along with them, English translations still missing from quite a few places. Not a must-see but worth taking a look if it suits your schedule.

title: Just outside is enough
text: While visiting Paris it is only natural to see this giant landmark and it is indeed very impressive. However I personally don't feel it is worth to pay the price to go up for the view, and definitely not for the overpriced services or restaurant!

title: Crowded and overpriced
text:
Grand palace with a lot luxury to gawk at. Photography is allowed. Everything you can buy in the area is incredibly overpriced, whether it be cafe snacks or souveniers.

There will always be a crowd no matter when you visit, so be prepared to move in close promixity with other visitors. Only place to get some breathing room is when walking the vast gardens area. I'd suggest getting a guided tour simply because waiting in line before the entrance takes a long while and there's no shelter from sun or rain.

If you don't wish to walk the large distances in the garden, those with a driver's license may rent a little golfcart to drive along a predetermined route. If you attempt to go the wrong direction, the car will stop working until you reverse.

title: Gorgeous cathedral
text: You'll have a hard time not finding this cathedral while in the city and you should take the time to visit it regardless if you follow the religion or not. The architecture is impressive even from just the outside!

title: Must for a Monet lover
text: If you're a Monet fan you'll want to visit here, but for a more casual traveler (like myself) this isn't really anything special. The colorful house isn't that colorful when you get to it and the garden is really just like any big garden.
